resources.string: English 16 a very nice puzzle invented in 1900 by the American Sam Loyd, also described as the greatest inventor of puzzles by Martin Gardner.

The goal of that game is to transpose the positions of the gold and silver coins in the minimum possible number of moves. Touch the coin to move it into the free square. A coin can be moved to a close vacant square, or jumped over a close coin to the vacant square. No trasversal moves or jumps are allowed.
Note: The shortest solution, which was discovered by the British mathematician H. E. Dudeney, is made of 46 moves.
You are the best! Please enter your name:
